para: As well as keeping track of which &nodes; are currently pinned, each &skel; maintains a stack of previous sets of pinned &nodes;. Whenever nodes are pinned or unpinned, a new set is pushed onto the stack. The Undo command operates on the specified &skel;, popping the latest configuration off of the stack, thereby reverting to the previous set of pinned &nodes;. The Redo command undoes the last Undo, replacing the most recently popped set of pinned &nodes; onto the stack.
The skeleton parameter is the fully-qualified name of the &skel; on which to operate.

note.para: Undone pinnings can be redone only if no new &nodes; were pinned or unpinned since the time of the last Undo.
